duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide comprehensive first evaluations for patients requiring involuntary commitments including completion of appropriate legal documentation to ensure proper compliance in the involuntary commitment process.

Provide emergency psychiatric and substance abuse assessments, diagnosis, and appropriate crisis intervention/supportive counseling/social work interventions to include referral and placement at other inpatient facilities and outpatient discharge planning, to patients/families identified by the Emergency Department as having significant psychiatric and substance abuse needs.
Must be flexible and adjust well to the needs of a fast-paced environment.
Provide clinical supervision to Master's level or Bachelor level mental health student interns.

education_certification.credential: Masters Degree in social work, counseling, Ph.D in psychology, or other equivalent degree in a recognized mental health field
